Summary Brett has broad-based EHS experience since 1987. Brett was the EHS Program Manager for Intel’s Construction program in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam after serving as EHS program manager for construction projects for Intel in the US Northwest over nine years. Beginning in 2009, Brett was the EHS Director for Skanska's Oregon Division, coordinating EHS strategies for projects in Oregon, Washington, California and Arizona. Brett served as Senior Consultant for Loflin Enviornmental Services in Houston and Albuquerque from 1987-1997. 
 
Encompassing over 30 million work hours in Oregon since 1998, Oregon's high-tech construction projects have set the benchmark for safe construction in the Pacific Northwest. Brett’s work with the region's well-embraced Injury-Free Environment initiative led to partnerships with many general contractors, subcontractors and trade unions in the area, as well as participation in the OR-OSHA Multi-Employer Workplace Task Force as an owner representative.  
 
Brett serves on the board of SafeBuild Alliance, a collaboration of owners, general contractors, trade contractors, labor, design firms and insurers committed to making Portland the safest place in the world for construction. 
 
As sophisticated companies recognize the efficiency and benefit of making safety a critical component of their business plans, organizational development and culture-building are the key areas of focus for Brett today. He has frequently been invited by local university construction management programs to present guest lectures on safety from an Owner’s perspective. 
 
Brett holds a degree in Management from Rice University in Houston, Texas, where he lived for 12 years. Brett grew up in New Orleans, and also lived in Albuquerque, New Mexico just prior to moving to Oregon with Intel in 1997. After a 3-year assigment in Vietnam, Brett returned to Oregon in 2009.
